did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of Homer G. Richey
[1946-1960]-1988
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 175 items.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Homer G. Richey, Accession #12709, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was given to the library in 1989 January 20 by Dr. Richey.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Homer G. Richey born ca. 1908 and is a native of Albemarle County, Virginia. He received his BA. and MA. from the Goettingen University in Germany and his Ph.D. from the University of Virginia? He studied and travelled widely. He served in the United States Air Force, taught German in the Army School of Military Government in Charlottesville, Virginia and was an instructor in the Disarmament School in London. He served as an Assistant Professor of Foreign Affairs at the University of Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of ca. 175 items (1 Hollinger Box, ca. 0.3 linear shelf feet) and dates from approximately 1946 to 1960, and 1988. This collection is comprised of correspondence regarding Homer G. Richey's dismissal as a member of the faculty of the Woodrow Wilson School of International Studies of the University of Virginia; in addition, it includes the minutes of the meetings of the Board of Visitors, press releases and transcripts of his radio broadcasts.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in 3 groups: 1. Introduction 2. Dr. Richey's fight with Colgate Darden, John Frederic Gange etc. and 3. Untitled
